data.title: Laser Tower Defence
data.solution:
n = gets.to_i
enemies = []
n.times do
  dist, dir = gets.split(" ")
  enemies.push({ dist: dist.to_i, dir: dir })  
end

current_direction = 'north'
enemies.sort_by! { _1[:dist] }.each do |e|
  if current_direction != e[:dir]
    current_direction = e[:dir]
    puts "look #{e[:dir]}"
  end
  puts 'shoot'
end
data.statement:
A Laser Tower Defence is installed in a road intersection, where many enemies are coming from the <<four>> directions: {{west}}, {{east}}, {{north}} and {{south}}, 
The tower is controller by these commands: {{shoot}}, {{look west}}, {{look east}}, {{look north}}, {{look south}}

The goal is to eliminate all enemy units, starting by the <<nearest>> to the <<farthest>>.

The commands are executed instantaneously. one shoot can only eliminate the first enemy intercepting it.

The tower is <<initially>> facing the {{north}}.
Each unit has a <<different>> distance to the center.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A Laser Tower Defence is installed in a road intersection, where many enemies are coming from the four directions: west, east, north and south,
The tower is controller by these commands: shoot, look west, look east, look north, look south

The goal is to eliminate all enemy units, starting by the nearest to the farthest.

The commands are executed instantaneously. one shoot can only eliminate the first enemy intercepting it.

The tower is initially facing the north.
Each unit has a different distance to the center.
Input
n : Number of enemy units.

distance direction : distance to center, direction from where a unit is coming, can be west, east, north or south,
Output
Minimum list of commands to execute in given order.
Constraints
distance_to_center>0
Example
Input
4
10 south
3 east
4 west
1 north
Output
shoot
look east
shoot
look west
shoot
look south
shoot
